Context: George Brown College offers experiential learning opportunities, including work-integrated learning, for students to gain sector-specific skills and industry experience. These opportunities can take place on or off campus. Work-integrated learning combines academic studies with practical experience in a workplace or practice setting, involving the student, college, and host organization. Some examples of WIL include those found in Information Systems Business Analysis program. Current students and employers have spoken positively about these opportunities, stating that they helped students find work in their field and perform well on the job. Interested individuals can sign up to receive updates on application deadlines, college news, events, tours, and more via email. Contact information for George Brown College includes a phone number (416-415-2000) and TTY number (1-877-515-5559), as well as an email address (ask.george@georgebrown.ca). The college's website contains information subject to change without notice.
